intro: Liabum dillonii, commonly known as the Dillon's liabum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss, Liabum dillonii is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
